original_solution_mapping.L1: 1/6 * 240 students = <<1/6*240=40>>40 students. So 40 students read three or more novels.
original_solution_mapping.L2: 35/100 * 240 students = <<35/100*240=84>>84 students. So 84 students read two novels.
original_solution_mapping.L3: 5/12 * 240 students = <<5/12*240=100>>100 students. So 100 students read a novel.
original_solution_mapping.L4: 240 students - (40 students + 84 students + 100 students) = 240 students - 224 students = <<240-(40+84+100)=16>>16 students. So 16 students don't read novels.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 301.
    Returns: the number of students who do not read novels.
    """
    # L1
    total_students = 240 # 240 sixth-grade students
    three_or_more_fraction = Fraction(1, 6) # 1/6 of students
    students_three_or_more_novels = three_or_more_fraction * total_students

    # L2
    two_novels_percentage = Fraction(35, 100) # 35% of students
    students_two_novels = two_novels_percentage * total_students

    # L3
    one_novel_fraction = Fraction(5, 12) # 5/12 of students
    students_one_novel = one_novel_fraction * total_students

    # L4
    sum_of_readers = students_three_or_more_novels + students_two_novels + students_one_novel
    students_no_novels = total_students - sum_of_readers

    # FA
    answer = students_no_novels
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: {three_or_more_fraction} * {total_students} students = <<{three_or_more_fraction}*{total_students}={students_three_or_more_novels}>>{students_three_or_more_novels} students. So {students_three_or_more_novels} students read three or more novels.

{two_novels_percentage} * {total_students} students = <<{two_novels_percentage}*{total_students}={students_two_novels}>>{students_two_novels} students. So {students_two_novels} students read two novels.
{one_novel_fraction} * {total_students} students = <<{one_novel_fraction}*{total_students}={students_one_novel}>>{students_one_novel} students. So {students_one_novel} students read a novel.

{total_students} students - ({students_three_or_more_novels} students + {students_two_novels} students + {students_one_novel} students) = {total_students} students - {sum_of_readers} students = <<{total_students}-({students_three_or_more_novels}+{students_two_novels}+{students_one_novel})={students_no_novels}>>{students_no_novels} students. So {students_no_novels} students don't read novels.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 1/6 * 240 students = <<1/6*240=40>>40 students. So 40 students read three or more novels.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 35/100 * 240 students = <<35/100*240=84>>84 students. So 84 students read two novels.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'students_two_novels' (value: 84) was reported instead of 'students_no_novels' (value: 16).
